alert.note: Alert for Marin; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 05 at 12:51PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Marin and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 445 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 PM PST, Heaviest rain may have ended, but streams and creeks continue to rise. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.1 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Healdsburg, Cloverdale, Sebastopol, Cotati, Roseland, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Larkfield-Wikiup, Forestville, Guerneville, South Santa Rosa, Graton, Occidental, Monte Rio, Glen Ellen, El Verano and Temelec. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
